item.title: 澳大利亚大选前展望赤字略有扩大
item.description: 根据周一发布的一份大选前更新报告，澳大利亚本财年和下一财年的预算赤字将略有扩大，该报告强调了在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布加征关税后，预测中的不确定性比往常更大。【原文：Australia’s budget will record slightly wider deficits this fiscal year and next, according to a pre-election update released Monday, which highlighted greater-than-usual uncertainty in forecasts following President Donald Trump’s tariff announcement.】

item.title: 受关税担忧影响，亚洲股指创 14 年来最大跌幅
item.description: 由于担心贸易战对全球经济的影响，中国股市引领了一场广泛而深入的大跌，亚洲股市暴跌，其中一个关键基准指数的跌幅为 14 年来最大。【原文：Stocks in Asia slumped, with a key benchmark sliding by the most in 14 years, as Chinese shares led a broad and deep selloff on worry over the trade war’s impact on the global economy.】

item.title: 欧拉二月份销售额增加，电动摩托车尚未推出
item.description: Ola Electric Mobility Ltd. 将其尚未推出的电动摩托车和电动滑板车的预订量计入了 2 月份的销售数字，使其市场份额看起来更大，因为该公司正在努力赢回投资者的信心。【原文：Ola Electric Mobility Ltd. counted its yet-to-be launched electric motorcycles and e-scooter bookings in its February sales number, making its market share look larger as it struggles to win back investor confidence.】

item.title: VIX 指数飙升表明 "恐慌"，全球股市下跌加速
item.description: 虽然全球股市正在加速下跌，但风险指标显示，美国股市正在领跌。【原文：While the stock-market rout is accelerating around the world, measures of risk indicate the US is leading the way.】

item.title: 全球市场低迷，印度投资者为本周艰难开局做好准备
item.description: (彭博社）— 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：(Bloomberg) — Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 澳大利亚 1 170 亿澳元养老金在动荡中寻求收购
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老基金之一 Aware Super 已经在准备购买价格更低廉的股票，以利用这场从全球股市中抹去数万亿美元的动荡。【原文：Aware Super, one of Australia’s largest pension funds, is already preparing to buy cheaper stocks and capitalize on the turmoil that’s wiping trillions of dollars from global equities.】

item.title: 中国央行连续第五个月购买黄金，黄金价格反弹
item.description: 3 月份，中国央行连续第五个月增加黄金储备，在全球贸易增长和地缘政治动荡的背景下，加深了对贵金属作为避险资产的押注。【原文：China’s central bank added gold to its reserves for a fifth straight month in March, deepening its bet on the precious metal as a haven asset amid rising global trade and geopolitical turmoil.】

item.title: 贸易敏感型澳大利亚资产因风险情绪飙升而下跌
item.description: 澳大利亚依赖贸易的资产继续下跌，投资者继续权衡美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税，而澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴尼塞则表示，澳大利亚政府将继续与美国保持接触。【原文：Australia’s trade-reliant assets extended their meltdown, with investors continuing to weigh President Donald Trump’s tariffs as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said his government will keep engaging with the US.】

item.title: 亚洲信贷指标闪现自早期大流行病以来的最大担忧
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普加倍推行其全球关税大棒并遭到中国报复后，风险资产溃败加深，亚洲的信用违约掉期爆出了自2020年 "科威德-19 "疫情恶化以来的最大跌幅。【原文：Credit-default swaps in Asia blew out the most since the worsening of the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020, as a rout in risk assets deepened after US President Donald Trump doubled down on his global tariff barrage and following retaliation from China.】

item.title: 贸易战加剧增长放缓忧虑，中国股市回落
item.description: 中国股市暴跌，债券收益率跌至历史新低，因为投资者正为世界两大经济体之间不断升级的贸易冲突所带来的后果做好准备。【原文：Chinese stocks plunged and bond yields fell toward a record low as investors braced themselves for the fall-out of a spiraling trade conflict between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 台湾假期归来，台积电受关税影响暴跌 10
item.description: 台湾半导体制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. tumbled by the stock exchange’s limit as trading resumed Monday in Taiwan, playing catchup to a global selloff triggered by President Donald Trump’s steep tariff hikes.】

item.title: 全球不确定性加剧，印度央行有望延长创纪录的现金刺激政策
item.description: 分析师称，印度储备银行将继续向银行系统注入创纪录的现金，以保护印度经济免受日益加剧的全球不利因素的影响。【原文：The Reserve Bank of India is set to extend its record cash infusions into the banking system as it shields the economy from mounting global headwinds, analysts say.】

item.title: 任天堂暴跌 10%，关税导致日股全军覆没
item.description: 任天堂公司和索尼集团公司周一在东京的股价下跌超过 10%，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普就其对美国进口商品征收影响深远的关税发表的最新言论加剧了日本股市的普遍下挫。【原文：Nintendo Co. and Sony Group Corp. shares fell by more than 10% in Tokyo on Monday amid a widespread selloff in Japan exacerbated by President Donald Trump’s latest comments on the far-reaching tariffs he’s imposed on US imports.】

item.title: 比特币在亚洲开盘时暴跌，加密货币感受到贸易战的痛苦
item.description: 进入本周，加密货币在亚洲市场大幅抛售，凸显了整个市场明显的风险厌恶情绪。【原文：Cryptocurrencies sold off sharply heading into the week in Asia, underscoring a clear risk-off sentiment across markets.】

item.title: 欧洲股票期货在 2020 年 3 月以来最差一周后下跌
item.description: 受唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布加征关税的影响，欧洲股票期货下滑，延续了该地区市场自 2020 年 3 月以来最糟糕一周的跌势。【原文：European stock futures slid, extending losses following the regional market’s worst week since March 2020 on the back of Donald Trump’s tariff announcements.】

item.title: 中国债券大涨，关税风险引发避险买盘和宽松押注
item.description: 由于对美国关税的担忧和货币宽松政策的押注，投资者纷纷抢购避险资产，中国政府债券大涨，将基准收益率推近历史最低点。【原文：China’s government bonds surged, pushing the benchmark yield close to the lowest on record, as investors rushed for haven assets due to concern over US tariffs and monetary easing bets.】

item.title: 日本石破致力于与美国就关税问题达成广泛协议
item.description: 日本首相石破茂表示，他希望达成一项范围广泛的协议，作为与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普就关税问题进行谈判的基础。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said he wants to put together a wide-ranging deal as the basis for negotiations with US President Donald Trump over tariffs.】

item.title: 亚太地区如何应对美国的互惠关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对美国全球贸易伙伴征收 10%基准关税的政策已于周六生效。虽然基线关税已经生效，但对一些国家征收的更高关税将于 4 月 9 日开始实施，这些关税将取代而不是增加 10%的税率。【原文：President Donald Trump’s 10% baseline tariffs on US trading partners around the world came into effect on Saturday. While the baseline charge has kicked in, higher duties on some countries — which replace, rather than add to the 10% rate — are due to start on April 9.】

item.title: 伍德赛德将把路易斯安那州液化天然气项目 40% 的股份出售给斯通尼克公司
item.description: 伍德赛德能源集团有限公司（Woodside Energy Group Ltd.）表示，斯通派克公司将为其拟议中的路易斯安那州液化天然气出口设施投资 57 亿美元，从而推动该项目作出最终投资决定。【原文：Woodside Energy Group Ltd. said Stonepeak will invest $5.7 billion in its proposed Louisiana liquefied natural gas export facility, advancing the project toward a final investment decision.】

item.title: 贸易战愈演愈烈，人民币贬值市场呼声渐高
item.description: 不断深化的贸易战正在引发金融市场的猜测，即中国可能会打破其追求货币稳定的政策，采取让人民币对美元大幅贬值的手段。【原文：The deepening trade war is raising speculation in financial markets that China may resort to aggressively devaluing the yuan against the dollar in a break of their policy of pursuing a stable currency.】

item.title: 特朗普在关税问题上步步紧逼，称协议取决于贸易平衡
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他并非有意助长市场抛售，但没有迹象表明他准备收回使美国股市损失数万亿美元的关税大棒。【原文：President Donald Trump said he was not intentionally fueling a market selloff but gave no indication he’s preparing to claw back the tariff barrage that has wiped trillions in value from US equities.】

item.title: 前景暗淡，日本名义工资增长成为亮点
item.description: 日本名义工资增幅超过预期，这对国内经济来说是一个积极信号，但与贸易有关的外部不利因素却给前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：Japan’s nominal wages rose more than expected in a positive sign for the domestic economy just as external headwinds related to trade are clouding the outlook.】

item.title: 亿万富翁阿克曼称特朗普启动关税是个 "错误
item.description: 潘兴广场公司（Pershing Square）的亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）说，唐纳德-特朗普总统决定在 4 月 9 日启动全球关税是一个 "错误"。【原文：President Donald Trump’s decision to launch global tariffs on April 9 is a “mistake,” Pershing Square’s billionaire founder Bill Ackman said.】

item.title: 关税动荡加深，S&P 500 指数期货下滑：市场综述
item.description: 周一早盘，随着投资者开始对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收对等关税的影响进行定价，美国股票期货暴跌，日元飙升，这表明整个金融市场的动荡正在加深。【原文：US equity futures slumped and the yen surged early Monday in a sign of deepening turmoil across financial markets as investors began to price in the fallout from Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs.】

item.title: 中国提出降息和产业援助以应对特朗普关税打击
item.description: 中国表示，如有必要，中国有空间放宽借贷成本和贷款人准备金规则，以抵御美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的最新关税。【原文：China said it has room to ease borrowing costs and reserve rules for lenders if needed to defend its economy against US President Donald Trump’s latest tariffs.】

item.title: 交易商评估关税动荡，黄金开盘进一步下跌
item.description: 本周开盘时，黄金延续跌势，因为投资者权衡了美国主导的贸易战带来的日益恶化的风险。【原文：Gold extended a drop at the week’s open, as investors weighed worsening risks from the US-led trade war.】

item.title: 马里在无人机被击落后召见阿尔及利亚大使
item.description: 马里一名政府官员周日表示，马里军队一架无人机在两国共同边界附近被击落，马里已召见阿尔及利亚大使。【原文：Mali has summoned Algeria’s ambassador after a Malian army drone was shot down near their shared border, a government official said Sunday.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧加剧，日本股市将暴跌
item.description: 日本股市将在周一开盘时继续下挫，在全球贸易战担忧加剧的情况下，投资者几乎没有喘息的余地。【原文：Japanese stocks are set to resume their selloff when the market opens on Monday, leaving investors little room to breathe amid intensifying fears over the global trade war.】

item.title: 特朗普团队在关税问题上步步紧逼，美国股指期货暴跌
item.description: 由于特朗普政府在贸易战中咄咄逼人，经济学家警告说，贸易战将使世界最大经济体陷入衰退，美国股票期货暴跌，使标准普尔500指数步入熊市。【原文：US equity futures plunged, putting the S&P 500 on track for a bear market as the Trump administration dug in on a trade war economists warn will tip the world’s largest economy into recession.】

item.title: 沙特降价，关税风险增加，石油市场延续跌势
item.description: 本周开盘时，沙特阿拉伯将其旗舰原油价格下调了两年多来的最大降幅，贸易战升级引发了对全球经济衰退和能源需求疲软的担忧，石油价格随之下跌。【原文：Oil fell at the week’s open after Saudi Arabia slashed its flagship crude price by the most in more than two years, and the escalating trade war spurred concerns about a global recession and weaker energy demand.】
